snippet: The abduction of at least eight more girls came as the Obama administration announced that it had offered to help find and prosecute those responsible for the mass abduction last month, claimed by the Boko Haram extremist group.
abstract: Kidnapping of 11 more girls in Nigeria's northeast by men suspected of being fighters from group Boko Haram puts new pressure on the country's troubled government; Pres Goodluck Jonathan's government appears to be floundering in response to crisis that has been transformed into a cause celebre by social media, spurring protests in the streets of the capital.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, Rick Gladstone from New York, and Hamza Idris from Maiduguri, Nigeria.

lead_paragraph: The abduction of at least eight more girls came as the Obama administration announced that it had offered to help find and prosecute those responsible for the mass abduction last month, claimed by the Boko Haram extremist group.

headline.main: New Kidnapping Reported in Nigeria as U.S. Offers Help
headline.print_headline: New Abductions Distress Nigeria; U.S. Offers Help
